definition: to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
early/prior/former/in advance/first
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to manufacture/to make
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: But a preemptive strike on Iranian soil would border on catastrophic. Consider
sentences.chinese: 然而先发制人袭击伊朗领土则是走进灾难。

sentences.english: Berlin opted to strike preemptively to preserve its security.
sentences.chinese: 柏林选择先发制人，保护国家安全。

sentences.english: Preemptive strikes are okay when you know for sure what you're preempting.
sentences.chinese: 当你确信你所占的先机，先发制人未尝不可。

sentences.english: Being overly preemptive makes us live in an imaginary future vs. in the present.
sentences.chinese: 过度先发制人使我们奔波于想象的未来和现实的当下。

sentences.english: Just think of what would happen if one nuclear power launched a preemptive on another.
sentences.chinese: 试想一下一个核大国先发制人会出现什么情况。

sentences.english: Take advantage of being a first mover. The search engines, and linkers , will reward you.
sentences.chinese: 先发制人，搜索引擎和连接者都会奖赏你。

sentences.english: Here are three scenarios in which preemptive cyberattacks could prevent bloodshed.
sentences.chinese: 下面三个先发制人的网络攻击场景可能防止流血冲突。

sentences.english: Indian outsourcing firms are preemptively opening offices all over the world to compete.
sentences.chinese: 印度外包商先发制人，满世界开设办事处增加竞争力。

definition: strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to take countermeasures against/to hit back/to counter
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
defensive position/guard
to gain the upper hand by a show of strength
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
surprise attack
key moment/decisive opportunity
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to hit back/to return fire
to win by a surprise move
